t: Amazon, My Face Wash, and Me - The Atlantic
s: September 6, 2019 - So after all my sleuthing, I came to think of some brand-name consumer products as things people pay extra for so the companies that make them can spend that extra money on getting people to buy more of those products in the future. In other words, consumers are picking up the tab for the advertising they themselves get bombarded with. I’ll take the private-label stuff, thanks. ... Joe Pinsker is a former staff writer at The Atlantic...
